sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Good morning Europe, it's Thursday the 2nd of December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Let's start the program by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Unfair and ineffective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The head of the UN slams COVID-19 travel bans, saying they won't stop the spread of the Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The Women's Tennis Association suspends all tournaments in China over concerns about the safety of double star Peng Shuai.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And conservative justices on the US Supreme Court signal they're ready to uphold a 15-week ban on abortion. The United States has become one of the latest nations to confirm a case of the COVID-19 Omicron

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: variant. It's been detected in California in someone who had recently returned from South Africa. The individual is self-quarantining and all close contacts have been contacted and all close contacts thus far have tested negative the individual was fully vaccinated and experienced mild symptoms which are improving at this point at least 23 other countries have reported omicron infections since south african authorities first identified the variant a week ago it It's an announcement that has led the US and many other nations to almost bar all airline travellers arriving from southern Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: It's a move heavily criticised by the UN's chief.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: With a virus that is truly borderless, travel restrictions that isolate any one country or region are not only deeply unfair and punitive, they are ineffective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Spain is one country tightening travel restrictions, but it still wants tourists to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Visitors from the United Kingdom who are not EU residents will only be able to enter Spain if they're fully vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It will no longer be sufficient to have a negative PCR test or to have had the disease. I think it's good. I think it's good measures to stop people coming in without having been vaccinated. It's just going to stop people coming over. It's as simple as that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Costa Blanca business owners can only hope the impact on tourists will be minimal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen has called for discussions on making Covid-19 jabs mandatory

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: in the face of the reluctance by some people to be vaccinated. Unexpectedly high case surges has led many member nations to renew steps to curb infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It is understandable and appropriate to lead this discussion now, how we can encourage and potentially think about mandatory vaccination within the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This needs discussion, this needs a common approach, but it is a discussion that I think has to be led.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Austria has officially extended its lockdown and was the first EU country to order mandatory vaccinations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Germany's incoming Chancellor Olaf Scholz is also in favour of mandatory COVID-19 jabs for all Germans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: New infections have soared in recent weeks, particularly in the east and south, with hospitals there already transferring intensive care patients to other parts of Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Vaccine producers like Moderna say mass vaccination programs are one of the best ways of fighting new coronavirus variants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's now the time to get vaccinated. You know, this variant seems to be concerning as you know, I hear from WHO, I hear from scientists around the planet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now it's the last moment and today it's probably the only weapon or in the therapeutic arsenal that we have.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's vaccination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So my recommendation is get boosted, get vaccinated to ensure that your immunity is as high as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: high as possible. Meanwhile, the WHO has said that vaccines remain the best way to combat the coronavirus pandemic, along with wearing masks and maintaining social distancing rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian officials have asked NATO to prepare a sanctions package against Russia in an effort to deter Moscow from launching an invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: NATO foreign ministers met for a second day in the Latvian capital Riga, where talks have been dominated by Russia's military build-up on its border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Seven years ago, Russia seized Crimea and then later annexed the territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The United States is particularly concerned about troop movements on the border and what Russia could be planning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP, President of the United States of America, We don't know whether President Putin has made the decision to invade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: We do know that he is putting in place the capacity to do so on short order, should he so decide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_18
sentences.sentence: So despite uncertainty about intentions and timing, we must prepare for all contingencies while working to see to it that Russia reverses course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Peter Dickinson is Ukraine editor at the Atlantic Council in Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: He says NATO members are looking into the possibility of economic sanctions if Russian troops cross into Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: of economic sanctions if Russian troops cross into Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's limited what NATO can actually put on the table.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At the moment, obviously, all sides, NATO itself, Ukraine and Russia, are aware that there is no real option of any military involvement from the NATO side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So what we're really talking about is economic sanctions, perhaps some political sanctions as well, but fundamentally it will be economic measures that would hopefully restrain Russia and cause them to think twice. We've had the US Secretary of State talking about measures that have not previously been considered. Some have speculated this may mean removal or restriction of Russia's access to things like the international SWIFT banking system, which would have a major impact on the Russian economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The question is whether these economic factors will be enough to deter Russia from something that many believe is a fundamental foreign policy priority for President Putin, which is to reassert Russian authority over Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Putin, which is to reassert Russian authority over Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Secretary Blinken and 56 other foreign ministers now head to Sweden for a two-day summit of the OSCE. There, Blinken's expected to hold talks with his Russian counterpart, Sergei Lavrov. Our reporter Per Bergfors Nyberg has the latest from Stockholm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sweden's foreign minister and Linda is hosting the ministerial council of the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe the OSCE here in Stockholm. Linda who's the chairperson in office has invited the 56 other foreign ministers of the OSCE including Russian foreign minister Sergei Lavrov and the. Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This annual two-day summit will be an opportunity to rebuild trust and to find common ground, Linda says, and to respond to the multiple challenges, crises and conflicts in the region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: High on the agenda will of course be the tensions between Russia and Ukraine, the migrant crisis on the border between Poland and Belarus and the unresolved Nagorno-Karabakh conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And the latest news is that there will even be a separate bilateral meeting between the U.S. and Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Security here in Stockholm is extremely tight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As you can see, there are armed guards, armed police officers guarding this place where the meeting will take place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: People here in Stockholm have been urged to leave their cars at home because of the extensive roadblocks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Police officers from all over Sweden have been called in to help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Even officers from the Swedish security police are here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Per Bergfrid Snöberg, Euronews, Stockholm.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Women's Tennis Association has announced the immediate suspension of all tournaments in China amid concern for the Chinese player Peng Shuai.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The 35-year-old disappeared from public view for three weeks after accusing a top Chinese official of sexual assault.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: WTA chief Steve Simon said in a statement that, "'In good conscience, I don't see how I can ask "'our athletes to compete there "'when Peng Shuai is not allowed to communicate freely "'and has seemingly been pressured "'to contradict her allegation of sexual assault.'" Peng's disappearance triggered an international outcry, despite attempts by the Chinese authorities to prove her well-being.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: WTA founder Billie Jean King has tweeted her support for Simon's actions, saying the organisation was on the right side of history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In October, China issued a statement stating that people should stop deliberating and maliciously politicizing and hyping up the issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Time for us to take a break now on Good Morning Europe. We'll be back in a few moments. Come on in, Sons of St. Louis. Demonstrators on both sides of the abortion argument gather outside the US Supreme Court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the biggest challenge to abortion rights in decades, a number of conservative justices

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: signalled their support for curbing abortion access.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The judges are being asked to consider whether the state of Mississippi can ban abortion at 15 weeks gestation, roughly nine weeks before bans are permitted under current law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Their decision could threaten the 1973 landmark Roe v. Wade ruling that guaranteed the constitutional right to abortion. I'm hoping that in this case the justices choose life, they choose to uphold the Mississippi law and I hope that we see this, if not a full overturning of Roe v. Wade, at least returning some of that power back to the states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: I love people who have had abortions, and I really am just here to support them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I've never had an abortion myself, but there is a chance that I might need one one day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_20
sentences.sentence: And this is just about abortion justice and liberating abortion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The case comes before the Supreme Court, which now, after three nominations under the Trump administration, has a 6-3 conservative majority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The ruling is expected in June, four months before next year's Congressional elections, and could become a campaign season rallying cry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Euronews reporter Ray Suarez is in Washington DC and was listening to the hearing on Wednesday. He says whatever the outcome of the case, America's bitter debate over abortion is far from over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The argument wrapped up just a few minutes ago. It was carried on at a very high level and it went to this basic question.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Who gets to decide whether a woman must carry a pregnancy to term or whether she is free to end that pregnancy if she so chooses?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Intense argument, questions from the justices of the Supreme Court, two lawyers on the various sides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: What's at stake?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: If the Mississippi law is upheld by the justices of the Supreme Court, it will leave states likely free to go their own way on abortion, to no longer be controlled by the precedents set by the Roe v. Wade decision in the early 1970s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: This has been a titanic 50-year battle over the right to abortion in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Instead of coming to an end, it will just open up a new front in that seemingly endless political war. But you're likely, if the Mississippi law stands, to end with a country where on one side of a state border a woman may terminate her pregnancy, but on the other side of that border, maybe a ten minute drive away, it might be, strictly speaking, illegal under almost any circumstances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It will leave state legislators free to go their own way and open a whole new battle in this world. According to a new poll, almost two-thirds of citizens in North Macedonia believe that

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: COVID-19 was created to control humans, as well as other unfounded conspiracy theories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Matthew in the Cube has been taking a look.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Citizens in the east of Europe are seeing vaccine hesitancy rates fly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Sales in fake coronavirus certificates are flourishing and conspiracy theories dominate the conversation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And now a new study has revealed the true scale of the issue in the Republic of North Macedonia. This poll was conducted by the Societas Sefilis Institute for Democracy. They surveyed 1,000 people in North Macedonia aged over 18 and these were their findings. They found that nearly 65% of people believe the unfounded theory that COVID-19 was created in a laboratory to control humans. While the World Health Organization has investigated the possibility that COVID-19 originated in a lab, there is no evidence to suggest it was created to supposedly control humans. Meanwhile the study found that 46% of people believe the theory that planes have been spraying the virus across North Macedonia. That is a baseless and debunked claim. And 46% of people believe the theory that planes have been spraying the virus across North Macedonia. That is a baseless and debunked claim. And 46% of people believe another unfounded theory that hospitals and the health ministry in North Macedonia have been amplifying the number of victims of COVID-19 because they are being paid to do so. Now analysts say that these kind of conspiracy theories are unsurprising given the amount of distrust in politicians and democratic institutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: North Macedonia authorities have been accused of mismanagement, such as in September, when 14 people were killed in a fire at a Covid-19 hospital in Tetevo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And analysts also say that a rise in populism in the country has contributed to the prevalence of these conspiracy theories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And these unfounded claims don't just relate to the coronavirus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That study also found that 29% of people in North Macedonia say they believe that climate change is a hoax.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, a massive 72% of people say they believe that the world is controlled by a handful of powerful families, both unfounded claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Earlier, I spoke to journalist Bojan Stojkovski, and he told me that the COVID-19 pandemic has been amplifying unfounded theories like this and making them commonplace for many in North Macedonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: BOJAN STOJKOVSKI, The rise of fake news here has been well documented years before.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: And I think that with the pandemic, it only serves to add another dimension.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Conspiracy theories and the trust in authorities, especially health authorities, I think are connected to each other. We definitely needed to have more efficient campaigns that would prevent all of this. So now we are only facing with the consequences and we are just trying to have some sort of damage control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: North Macedonia, like many countries in Europe, battling a high level of infections, but polls still showing that many in the country believe unfounded and baseless theories about the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: French researchers may have found a way to fight over fishing with a smart net that can help sort fish even before they are brought on board.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The device that is still under review is equipped with cameras and sensors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It is able to film the fish in the nets and identify them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The potentially revolutionary system is currently being tested in the open sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Here we can see, for example, in blue all the horse mackerel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They are caught on screen using artificial intelligence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In pink we can see all the sardines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Fishermen can be informed about their catches in real time and activate escape devices in the trawler.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Globally every year, 20 million tonnes of fish, that's around 25% of total catches, are discarded at sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: That's according to the UN Food and Agriculture Agency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: This wastage varies depending on the species being fished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I'm not interested in having the fish on the deck and sorting them once they're dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I prefer to sort them once they're at the bottom in the water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: That's why this project is interesting because we'll know at all times what's going into the net.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The researchers are also developing other smart fishing aids like a net with openings that can allow non-target fish to be released.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There's also this bottom trawl that lifts to avoid damaging the seabed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: These new fishing technologies are expected to be expensive when they hit the market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It may mean that they are unaffordable to many fishermen in France who already say finances are tight due to the dispute with the United Kingdom over access to fishing zones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: That's it from me and the entire team here on Euronews. Don't forget though, you can stay up to date with our top stories by checking out our website euronews.com. Three, two, one. We'll see you next time.
